fields.headline: What's on?
fields.bodyText: March 21-23 Healthcare Computing 2005 conference, Harrogate. Speakers include Ian Watmore, the government's chief information officer and Richard Granger, director general of NHS IT. April 11-12 International Public eProcurement seminar, San Sebastian, Spain. Organised by the European Centre for the Regions and the European Institute of Public Administration. April 20-21 E-government regional conference, London. Last of a series of events to demonstrate the fruits of the Office of the Deputy Prime Minister's £85m programme of e-government projects. April 28 Socitm spring conference, Coventry. Speakers include Sir Nicholas Montagu, former chairman of the Inland Revenue. May 9-10 UK government IT summit, London. The main item on the agenda is ensuring a return on the government's IT investment. May 24 Global forum on reinventing government, Seoul, South Korea. June 21-22 Government Computing conference, London. July 13 London Connects conference, London. Fifth annual event on the capital's e-programmes. October 16-18 Socitm annual conference, Brighton. Celebrating the imminent arrival of local e-government - and looking to the world beyond the targets. November 24-25 Third Ministerial eGovernment conference, London. Organised as part of the UK presidency of the EU. Likely to feature some high profile government speakers, especially as the UK is now officially Europe's number three e-government. December 31 Prime minister's deadline for all public services capable of being delivered electronically to be available electronically.
